items.title: New low knocks 8BitDo’s officially licensed Xbox all-button arcade controller down to $48 (Save 52%)
items.summary:
As part of its ongoing video game sale, Woot is offering the officially licensed Xbox variant of 8BitDo’s All-Button Arcade Controller for $47.99 Prime shipped (a $6 delivery fee will apply otherwise). Be sure to enter promo code LEVEL20 to see the discounted price during checkout. This particular variant of the controller is compatible with Xbox Series X|S and Windows PCs, and it typically goes for $100 at Amazon, where it’s currently fetching $97. Today’s deal knocks 52% off, shaving $48 from its usual price. It dropped to $60 just earlier this month as part of a similar Woot sale, but today’s offer undercuts that by another $12 to mark a new all-time low. Notably, the standard variant compatible with Switch 2 is also down to $47.99 Prime shipped, which is also the lowest price we have tracked for it.

more…

items.title: Don’t miss Lexar’s 1TB SL500 portable SSD while it’s down to its lowest price in months at $105
items.summary:
While you can still grab Samsung’s T5 EVO 4TB drive for $299, we just spotted another solid SSD deal at Walmart that’s worth considering. You can now grab Lexar’s 1TB SL500 portable drive for $105 shipped. This model has been hovering closer to $190 in recent months amid rising SSD prices, with some third-party Amazon listings even pushing it up to $300. Today’s Walmart deal drops it back down to one of the lowest prices we’ve tracked in a while. It is, in fact, less than what it was going for before prices started climbing. This particular listing also includes the magnetic set, which adds a snap-on case and ring so you can attach the drive to your phone or laptop. For comparison, Best Buy currently has some third-party listings for it at $150, making Walmart’s offer the better value right now.

more…

This is one of the brand’s newer smart lighting options that is particularly ideal for kitchen islands and carries a $150 full price outside of deals. After we last saw this same price appear during Black Friday and Christmas sales, it kept above $120 throughout January and February until now. Jumping on this deal while it lasts gives you a $40 markdown off the going rate, landing it back at its all-time lowest tracked price. We also recently spotted a number of Govee’s popular outdoor lighting options that you can browse here, as well as the brand’s current floor lamp discounts here.

items.title: Keep music thumping for up to 15 hours with JBL’s Xtreme 3 portable Bluetooth speaker at $200 (Reg. $330), more from $31
items.summary:
Amazon is currently offering the JBL Xtreme 3 Portable Bluetooth Speaker for $199.99 shipped in either a black, blue, or camo colorway. Down from a $330 full price, it’s been mostly keeping between $250 and $220 over the last year, with falls popping up regularly to $200 and $190 (the latter having last been seen during July’s Prime Day event). The deal here gives you a 39% markdown that cuts $130 off the going rate, landing it at the best price in the last seven months and the second-best price of the last year, making it a far more affordable option over the latest Xtreme 4 speaker that is sitting at $370 right now, down from its $380 full price. We’ve also rounded up a collection of JBL’s other speakers, headphones, and earbuds benefiting from discounts below.

items.title: This compact 3,200mAh portable area light covers up to 6 nights of illumination while doubling as a power bank from $24 (39% off)
items.summary:
BougeRV Portable Camping Area Light

Buy for $24 (Reg. $40)

What we love

As you prep those spring and summer outing plans (once we shake off all this winter snowfall), you might want to consider adding this BougeRV portable area light to your kit – and it’s great for year-round use, too. With four colorway options, this light sports a 3,200mAh battery that can keep spaces illuminated for up to 6 nights on a single charge, complete with five adjustable brightness levels, four lighting modes, and even an S.O.S. signal for emergencies. What’s more, it even doubles as a power bank to keep your phone or other essentials powered up when off-grid or far from any outlet.

Don’t forget to enter promo code LEVEL20 during checkout to see the discounted price. This is regularly a $70 gamepad, which is now seeing a solid 42% discount. Today’s deal knocks $30 off the regular price, landing it $2 below what we saw last month. All three variants – Purple, Gray, and G Classic – are down to just $40 today, so you can pick your favorite after checking out the details below.
